sentences.en: He shivered, feeling a muffled anticipation and elation.
sentences.cn: 他不禁打了个寒噤.心里隐隐感到有了盼头.

sentences.en: Her anger passed like remote flare of elation.
sentences.cn: 她的怒气象淡淡的兴奋一闪即逝.

sentences.en: Her moods oscillated between depression and elation.
sentences.cn: 她的情绪时而抑郁，时而亢奋。

sentences.en: His elation may well be imagined.
sentences.cn: 他那得意的神情完全可以想象出来.

sentences.en: His supporters have reacted to the news with elation.
sentences.cn: 他的支持者们听到这个消息后兴高采烈。

sentences.en: I felt a strange sense of elation.
sentences.cn: 我有一种异常的兴奋感觉.

sentences.en: My mother was filled with elation when I got this good job.
sentences.cn: 我妈妈很高兴我得到这份好工作.

sentences.en: Ruth was filled with elation at having won the prize.
sentences.cn: 露丝因得到奖品而得意洋洋.

sentences.en: She showed her elation at having finally achieved her ambition.
sentences.cn: 最终实现了抱负,她显得十分高兴.

sentences.en: The elation of success, which surely now flamed high in Osmond.
sentences.cn: 成功的意识现在必然已在奥斯蒙德的心头熊熊燃烧.

sentences.en: There were sighs of relief and gasps of elation.
sentences.cn: 有人发出如释重负的叹息声,有人发出兴奋的喘息声.

sentences.en: These bright colors may fill our hearts with elation, but to many they are daily taunts.
sentences.cn: 这些鲜艳的色彩可能使我们心中洋溢着快乐, 但对许多人来说,它们是日常的嘲笑.

sentences.en: They were filled with elation and amazement for the results.
sentences.cn: 他们对这个结果是惊喜交集.

sentences.en: This little incident filled me with elation.
sentences.cn: 这一小插曲令我充满欢欣.

sentences.en: Universal celebrations are held and the whole nation is in elation.
Which the elation of liberty and the pain of exclusion were indistinguishably mingled.
sentences.cn: 她既为自由而洋洋得意,又因未能参加而不胜伤心,两种感情难分难解地纠集在一起.

words.tran_cn: 兴高采烈的；得意洋洋的
使兴奋（elate的过去式和过去分词）

trans.tran_cn: 兴高采烈，欢欣鼓舞，（病态的）欣快，欣快症
trans.tran_en: a feeling of great happiness and excitement
